Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the incident by stating that the BJP leader was "driven away" by the public, when it was actually a scuffle between the BJP worker and Congress members.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a single video shared on social media without any additional evidence or verification.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the incident is related to the upcoming Bihar elections and the Hathras gang-rape case, without providing any evidence or connection between the two.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by news organizations that the incident took place in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, and was a scuffle between BJP and Congress members, unrelated to the Bihar elections.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the incident did not involve the public driving away the BJP leader, but rather a scuffle between political party members.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in this case.
